description: Borrowed from Turkish baklava, from Ottoman Turkish باقلوا‎ (baklava) (see for more); possibly from Middle Mongol ᠪᠠᠭᠯᠠᠭ᠎ᠠ (baɣlaɣ'a, “bundle, package”).

entries.meaning: A popular sweet pastry found in many cuisines of the Middle East and the Balkans, made of chopped nuts layered with phyllo pastry. [since c. 1650; modern spelling since 1800s]
